intro: Erigeron nannogeron, commonly known as the narrowleaf fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Its narrow, linear leaves and showy yellow-centered flowers bloom from summer to early fall. It is often used in native plant gardens for its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
